SENT.plain: Two cases of internal carotid artery occlusion secondary to spontaneous dissection are reported
Both patients presented with transient ischemic attacks. both had antiplatelet aggregation therapy, followed by spontaneous resolution of the occlusion
The period of healing seems to be relatively short
In both cases, restoration of flow was angiographically documented 14 days and 10 weeks after the initial arteriogram
Strategies for treatment of such patients are discussed
